faqs.response: For bleeding: Apply direct pressure with clean cloth. Elevate the wound above heart level if possible. Hold pressure for 10 minutes without peeking. If bleeding doesn't stop, seek immediate medical help.
Fire emergency: Get low and crawl under smoke. Feel doors before opening - if hot, find another exit. If clothes catch fire: Stop, Drop, and Roll. Call emergency services immediately.
Flood situation: Move to highest ground immediately. Avoid walking in moving water. Stay away from electrical equipment. Signal for help with bright objects or sounds. Do not drink flood water.

During earthquake: Drop, Cover, and Hold On. Get under sturdy furniture. Stay away from windows and heavy objects. If outdoors, move away from buildings. After shaking stops, check for injuries and hazards.
Possible heart attack: Sit down and stay calm. Chew aspirin if available and not allergic. Loosen tight clothing. Call emergency services immediately. Do not drive yourself to hospital.
For choking: Encourage coughing first. If unable to cough, perform Heimlich maneuver: Stand behind person, place hands below ribcage, thrust upward and inward firmly. Repeat until object dislodged.
Suspected fracture: Do not move the injured area. Immobilize with splint using rigid material. Apply ice wrapped in cloth. Elevate if possible. Seek medical attention immediately.
For burns: Cool with cold running water for 10-20 minutes. Remove jewelry before swelling. Do not use ice or butter. Cover with clean cloth. For severe burns, seek immediate medical help.
If lost: Stay calm and stay put if safe. Make yourself visible with bright colors. Use whistle or shout for help. Conserve energy and water. Mark your location for rescuers.
For food and water needs: Ration existing supplies. Collect rainwater if safe. Avoid unknown plants or water sources. Signal for help. Priority is rescue, not foraging.
